top_categories.workout_context: Race-pace efforts that mimic Nova Eroica's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before October.
Nova Eroica's Tuscan strade bianche (white roads) (70%), Paved roads (30%) forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 84 miles.
109ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Nova Eroica, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
9,186ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Nova Eroica. Train it until it feels boring.
At mile 60 of 84, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
9,186ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Nova Eroica, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on tuscan strade bianche—rolling white gravel roads. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 9,186ft of climbing on tuscan strade bianche—rolling white gravel roads does to your power file on race day.
Low-cadence force work for 9,186ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Nova Eroica’s 84 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Nova Eroica requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on tuscan strade bianche—rolling white gravel roads to build confidence. Expect: tuscan strade bianche (white roads) (70%), paved roads (30%), rolling tuscan hills.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Race Simulation, Gravel Specific, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 84 miles of tuscan strade bianche—rolling white gravel roads in Buonconvento, Tuscany, Italy.
